headline: Pretty good
pros:
nice office
some smart co-workers
lunch on fridays was good
cons: partner in charge had ego issues

headline: Lack of growth opportunities and learning curve is limited.
pros: It's a good place to work if you are either 1) starting out in your career or 2) established professional who is content with his/her role and responsibilities.
cons: One big issue is Poor Communication skills throughout the firm.  And it feels like you are a cast member of "The Office" and working with senior management like Michael Scott.  Management (mainly the portfolio managers) has a tendency to hire the incompetents from outside the firm for senior positions instead of promoting within the firm.
